channel.title: [Class Rework] Marshal
channel.description: > # [color = "purple"]The Marshal[/color] :shield: > **[color = "purple"] Unseen Investigator [/color]** > > Day Ability 1: **Besmirch** If targeted player is executed today, they will appear as chosen class. You will know what class they really were. Can be used on yourself and Unseen.( 2 or 1 use(s) ) > > > Night Ability 1: **Intercept** - Select two targets, if anyone targets your first target the will receive feedback as if they targeted the second.(infinite) > Night Ability 2: **Probe** - Determine a player’s class if they can be converted, including if calm minded or empowered.( 3 uses)

item.title: [Class Rework] Marshal
item.dc:creator: invoker
item.description:
true, I will put this idea on board as I am thinking of doing a social class version of this but I wanted to come up with results first on what everyone thought this since I couldn’t think of the bd version

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Rework] Marshal
item.dc:creator: Geyde
item.description:
invoker:

yes but used incorrectly could have a dire effect if someone was basically confirmed unseen and turned out to be “bd”

You got a point there. If unseen, this ability could out yourself when mistimed. But so can an improper defile while being a phys claim. It shares a similar issue that defile, but is also far more applicable in its usage. The real problem with Besmirch is it being a day ability, and therefore it can be used as a reaction, which requires significantly less thought to use with an incredibly strong effect to boot.

The offensive potential of this is still ridiculous.

In the end, Besmirch would make a really good night ability, for a different class. I’d suggest incorporating this into a support unseen class. I don’t know what that would look like, but Besmirch would make a very interesting ability if that were to exist.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Rework] Marshal
item.dc:creator: Lightsin
item.description:
Geyde:

Probe doesn’t need a nerf, given that Nightwatch has exact class determining abilities (WC).

You mean Unseen doesn’t need a second foresight?

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Rework] Marshal
item.dc:creator: invoker
item.description:
yes but used incorrectly could have a dire effect if someone was basically confirmed unseen and turned out to be “bd” then that would make the sheriff claim especially suspicious, used incorrectly if can have grave consequences leading to 2 unseen get lynched, but if the player using it is very skilled they can practically fool bd.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Rework] Marshal
item.dc:creator: Geyde
item.description:
invoker:

Night Ability 1: Intercept - Select two targets, if anyone targets your first target the will receive feedback as if they targeted the second.(infinite)

This ability doesn’t seem like something an investigative class would do (information manipulation) even if Duchess has dark wisp. It would be better suited on a social/support class.

It also wouldn’t work correctly with butler/drunk (certain), and probably not with other classes (uncertain).

For example, butler targets 3.
Marshal selects butler and 8.

Butler gets feedback telling them they successfully occupied 8, with out any ‘redirected’ feedback telling them why that happened. This proves the existence of converted sheriff mechanically.

invoker:

Night Ability 2: Probe - Determine a player’s class if they can be converted, including if calm minded or empowered.( 3 uses)

Probe doesn’t need a nerf, given that Nightwatch has exact class determining abilities (WC).

invoker:

Day Ability 1: Besmirch If targeted player is executed today, they will appear as chosen class. You will know what class they really were. Can be used on yourself and Unseen.( 2 or 1 use(s) )

Extremely OP. Can be used to confirm unseen and to effectively frame bd. The weakness of Scorned’s disguising ability is that it few effective uses, while having to predict who will be hung the next day. It’s unreliable.

Besmirch can effectively (and efficiently as it is a day ability) eliminate the downsides of making aggressive plays as unseen while also allowing them to unconfirm investigative BD classes.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Rework] Marshal
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
invoker:

Day Ability 1: Besmirch If targeted player is executed today, they will appear as chosen class. You will know what class they really were. Can be used on yourself and Unseen.( 2 or 1 use(s) )

I like this, but it doesn’t really fit the theme of the class.

invoker:

Night Ability 1: Intercept - Select two targets, if anyone targets your first target the will receive feedback as if they targeted the second.(infinite)

Again, this is fine but doesn’t fit the theme

invoker:

Night Ability 2: Probe - Determine a player’s class if they can be converted, including if calm minded or empowered.( 3 uses)

Why did you just nerf probe? Probe is balanced, it needs a buff if anything

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Rework] Marshal
item.dc:creator: invoker
item.description:
The Marshal

Unseen Investigator

Day Ability 1: Besmirch If targeted player is executed today, they will appear as chosen class. You will know what class they really were. Can be used on yourself and Unseen.( 2 or 1 use(s) )

Night Ability 1: Intercept - Select two targets, if anyone targets your first target the will receive feedback as if they targeted the second.(infinite)
Night Ability 2: Probe - Determine a player’s class if they can be converted, including if calm minded or empowered.( 3 uses)

Read full topic
